item.title: By: Mike Waters
item.dc:creator: Mike Waters
item.content:encoded:
Amen. The paragraph quoted from patriach.org is tragic. You find similar statements in Philip Lancaster’s Family Man, Family Leader (although there is much good also):

“The family is central to God’s plan to advance the gospel and kingdom of Jesus…”

“The home has always been the foundation and center of true faith in the world…”

“Throughout the ages the family has been the nursery of faith for each new generation, the primary place in which Christian discipleship has occurred…”

Statements such as these give the impression that the church has been replaced by the family. This is what I would describe as the radical aspects of FIC. From this, men such as Scott Brown need to be distinguished.
